intro: Stephanodaphne cuspidata, commonly known as the narrowleaf stephanodaphne, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
